criteria.name: Psychiatric History Taking
subcriteria: Asked about onset and duration of symptoms
Explored nature and severity of symptoms
Inquired about medications and treatment history

criteria.name: Risk Assessment
subcriteria: Assessed for suicidal ideation, plan, intent
Asked about homicidal thoughts if relevant

criteria.name: Biopsychosocial Assessment
subcriteria: Asked about social support and relationships
Considered family history of mental illness

criteria.name: Interview Structure & Completeness
subcriteria: No major gaps in psychiatric evaluation

grading_scale.9-10: Excellent - Demonstrates advanced psychiatric interviewing skills
grading_scale.7-8: Good - Competent mental health assessment with minor gaps
grading_scale.5-6: Satisfactory - Basic skills present but needs improvement
grading_scale.3-4: Needs Improvement - Significant gaps in psychiatric interview
grading_scale.0-2: Poor - Does not demonstrate safe psychiatric assessment skills
